meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a jockey.
meanings.sent1: The small, jockeyish man wore a colorful racing outfit.
meanings.sent2: The jockeyish hat perched jauntily on his head as he rode the horse.
meanings.sent3: The jockeyish costume made him look like a professional horse rider.
meanings.sent4: Her swift movements on the dance floor were as jockeyish as a rider on a horse.
meanings.sent5: The jockeyish attire made him stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a manner typical of a jockey.
meanings.sent1: She had a jockeyish way of guiding the conversation smoothly.
meanings.sent2: His jockeyish behavior showed in the way he confidently handled the reins.
meanings.sent3: The jockeyish way he maneuvered through the crowd was impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her jockeyish control of the situation saved the day.
meanings.sent5: He approached the task with a jockeyish determination.
